channel.title: [CODE RELEASE] RSC Client 204 C# Port (Not the Remake)
channel.description:
Hi once again!
https://github.com/zerratar/RSCXNA
This is an old project of mine, started ages ago, I know that I have posted pictures of it in the past.
This is a direct conversion from the moparclassic client made in java, ported to c#. Using XNA for rendering. It has some problems with rendering some roofs in some areas. Altough if you switch the "roofs on/off" in the client then it all looks good :P
Also, some CPU usage problem may occour if " IsFixedTimeStep " is enabled in the game.
I'm not sure if I changed it to false or not (before this commit to github),
This is built using .NET framework 4.0 and XNA 4.0.
Cheers, Zerratar

item.title: [CODE RELEASE] RSC Client 204 C# Port (Not the Remake)
item.dc:creator: @zerratar zerratar
item.description:
@zerratar wrote:

Hi once again!

GitHub

zerratar/RSCXNA

RSCXNA - An open source RuneScape Classic client ported to C# using XNA for rendering, this is a direct java to c# conversion, with no major changes to the client except for refactoring and some so...

This is an old project of mine, started ages ago, I know that I have posted pictures of it in the past.

This is a direct conversion from the moparclassic client made in java, ported to c#. Using XNA for rendering. It has some problems with rendering some roofs in some areas. Altough if you switch the “roofs on/off” in the client then it all looks good

Also, some CPU usage problem may occour if " IsFixedTimeStep " is enabled in the game.

I’m not sure if I changed it to false or not (before this commit to github),

This is built using .NET framework 4.0 and XNA 4.0.

Cheers,
Zerratar

Read full topic
